differences.gitbook: AshleyDawn, Ayo, Clement Umoh, Effiom, Eric Davies, kateri, LordKizzy, martinsoki, Mikasa, Photogee
differences.supabase: Ashley Coventry, Ayo, Clement Umoh, Effiom, Eric Davies, Eric Davis, kateri, lord kizzy, martinsoki, Mikasa, Photogee

differences.gitbook:
Kick-off: Photogee welcomed everyone with a warm greeting, and then we tackled the action items from the last meeting. Effiom shared an update on the status of the "strategy core" and "strategy member" Discord tags. He stated that the tags haven‚Äôt taken effect because there‚Äôs still a back-and-forth issue that needs to be fixed. He hinted that at the next meeting or workshop, he‚Äôd give an update on the status.

Budget Fitting: Momentarily, we had a budget fitting walkthrough by Effiom; some deliverables will be moved to Q1 2025 and there will only be 1 workshop session in Q4, while a few things are removed to fit the budget. 

Q4 Task Roster & Async Follow-up: Ayo took to the stage and assured everyone with their names on the roster of getting a task in Q4. We also discussed what to do with members who haven‚Äôt been showing up for meetings; Ayo added that we can swap those names with active members who would like to take up tasks. We also discussed Q3 workshop follow-up. These groups of people will attend WG meetings of marketing guild, video workgroup, and writers workgroup, and collect information about what strategy was adopted in the workgroup from the last strategy guild workshop and how it‚Äôs going. To this effect, we have Photogee and Ese to take on the Q3 workshop follow-up while Cjfrankie and Mikasa take on the Q4 workshop follow-up.

More on Workshops: We have decided that there will be only one workshop session in Q4, focusing on R&D Guild and Education Guild. These workshops will start next Monday (11th Nov) and run for 3 straight weeks. Cjfrankie and Mikasa are to attend both the R&D and the Education guild meetings, and ask them to select three members that will represent them well.

Research Update: Effiom shared an update on the research he‚Äôs working on about what people in the Ambassador Program think about Strategy Guild. The survey form is complete and is ready to be sent out to gather responses from community members. He sought feedback on the survey and encouraged members to check out the form and add comments.

Looking Ahead: As Q4 wraps up, we looked forward to having a promising Q1 in 2025. Ayo said the strategy guild welcomes research ideas, initiatives, workshops, and collaboration from members. As a matter of finality, he added that Q1 2025 won‚Äôt only be about facilitation and documentation. Rather, it‚Äôs about strategy stuff.

AOB: The AOB session was led by Ayo, who sought two people who would liaise with the marketing guild for their content calendar ‚Äî if we have any content for the socials, the idea is to have two people who would be in close communication with the marketing guild for proper scheduling of posts.
differences.supabase:
Kick-off: The biweekly meeting of the strategy guild started strong with Photogee as he welcomed everyone with a warm greeting, and then we skimmed and tackled the action items from the last meeting. Firstly, Effiom shared an update on the status of the strategy core and strategy member tags üè∑Ô∏è He stated that the tags haven‚Äôt taken effect because there‚Äôs still a back-and-forth issue that needs to be fixed. He hinted that at the next meeting or workshop, he‚Äôd give an update on the status.

Budget Fitting: Momentarily, we had a budget fitting walkthrough by Effiom; he added that some deliverables will be moved to Q1 2025 and there would only be 1 workshop session in Q4, while a few things are removed to fit the budget. 

Q4 Task Roster & Async Follow-up: Ayo took to the stage and assured everyone with their names on the roster of getting a task in Q4. We also featured a discussion about what to do with members who haven‚Äôt been showing up for meetings; Ayo added that we can swap those names with active members who would like to take up tasks. We also featured discussions centered around Q3 workshop follow-up. These groups of people will attend WG meetings (marketing guild, video workgroup, and writers workgroup,) and collect information about what strategy was adopted in their workgroup from the last strategy guild workshop and how it‚Äôs going. To this effect, we have Photogee and Ese to take on the Q3 workshop follow-up while Cjfrankie and Mikasa take on the Q4 workshop follow-up.

More on Workshop: We have decided that there will be only one workshop session in Q4. These workshops will focus on the R&D guild and education guild. These workshops shall commence next Monday and run for 3 straight weeks. In light of such, Cjfrankie and Mikasa are to attend both the R&D and the education guild meetings just so the workgroup can signpost three members that will represent them well.

Research Update: Effiom shared an update on the research he‚Äôs working on. He hinted that the survey form is complete and is ready to be sent out to gather responses from community members. Additionally, he sought to get some feedback concerning the survey and then encouraged members to check out the form and add comments, too.

Looking Ahead: As Q4 wraps up, the strategy workgroup looks forward to having a promising Q1 in 2025. According to Ayo, he mentioned that the strategy guild welcomes research ideas, initiatives, workshops, and collaboration from members. As a matter of finality, he added that Q1 2025 won‚Äôt only be about facilitation and documentation. Rather, it‚Äôs about strategy stuff.

AOB: The AOB session was led by Ayo, who sought two people who would liaise with the marketing guild in view of the content calendar ‚Äî Just so we have any content for the socials, the idea is to have two people who would be in close communication with the marketing guild for proper scheduling of posts.
